com.xrtb.geo

Class GeoTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xrtb.geo.GeoTag

  • public class GeoTag
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that does specialized geo tagging. Given a GPS coordinate, returns the closest US zip code.
    Author:
    Ben M. Faul

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double ERADIUS
      Earth radius in km
      double PI
      PI to 5 digits

      • initTags

        public void initTags(java.lang.String zipState,
                     java.lang.String datafile)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads the database or zip codes and zip code states.
        Parameters:
        zipState - String. The path of the zip codes in state database
        datafile - String. The path of the zip code cestroids
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on file errors

      • loadDatabase

                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads the zipcode centroids/
        Parameters:
        path - String. The path of the zip code geo codes
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on file errors.

      • loadZipMap

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on file errors

      • getSolution

        public Solution getSolution(double lat,
                            double lon)
        Given a GPS coordinate, return the solutin (zipcode, state, county, and city).
        Parameters:
        lat - double. The GPS latitude.
        lon - double. The GPS longitude
        Returns:
        Solution. Where this GPS location is.

      • getRange

        public double getRange(double lat1,
                       double long1,
                       double lat2,
                       double long2)
        Returns the range in km between two GPS points.
        Parameters:
        lat1 - double. The latitiude of the first point.
        long1 - double. The longitude of the first point.
        lat2 - double. The latitude of the second point.
        long2 - double. The longitude of the second point.
        Returns:
        double. The range in km.

      • makeKey

        public java.lang.String makeKey(double d)
        Makes a string key of 2 digits accuracy. Example 74.2344 is converted to '74.23'
        Parameters:
        d - double. The value to turn into a key.
        Returns:
        String. The string representation of the key value of 'd' to 2 digits (truncated).
